rainfalls:
Heavy Rainfall Warning No. 2 #NCR_PRSD

Weather System: Southwest Monsoon (Habagat)

Issued at: 2:00 AM, 03 July 2025(Thursday)



YELLOW WARNING LEVEL: Metro Manila, Bataan, Rizal(San Mateo, Rodriguez), Bulacan(San Jose del Monte, Norzagaray, Marilao, Meycauayan, Obando) and Cavite(Ternate, Naic, Tanza, Rosario, Noveleta, Cavite City, Bacoor, Maragondon, General Trias, Kawit, Imus).

ASSOCIATED HAZARD: FLOODING in flood-prone areas.





Meanwhile, expect light to moderate with occasional heavy rains over Laguna, Quezon, Nueva Ecija and Tarlac within the next 3 hours.

Light to moderate with occasional heavy rains affecting Zambales, Pampanga, Batangas, Cavite(Alfonso, Amadeo, General Emilio Aguinaldo, Indang, Magallanes, Mendez, Silang, Tagaytay, Trece Martires, Carmona, Dasmarinas, Gen. Mariano Alvarez), Rizal(Antipolo, Tanay, Angono, Baras, Binangonan, Cainta, Cardona, Jala-Jala, Morong, Pililla, Taytay, Teresa) and Bulacan(Angat, Balagtas, Baliuag, Bocaue, Bulakan, Bustos, Calumpit, Malolos, Dona Remedios Trinidad, Guiguinto, Hagonoy, Pandi, Paombong, Plaridel, Pulilan, San Ildefonso, San Miguel, San Rafael, Santa Maria) which may persist within 3 hours.

The public and the Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Offices concerned are advised to MONITOR the weather condition and watch for the next warning to be issued at 5:00 AM today.

For more information and queries, please call telephone numbers 8927-1335 and 8927-2877 or log on to www.pagasa.dost.gov.ph.
thunderstorms:
Thunderstorm Watch #NCR_PRSD

Issued at: 10:00 PM, 02 July 2025



Thunderstorm is MORE LIKELY to develop over Greater Metro Manila Area(Metro Manila, Bulacan, Rizal, Laguna and Cavite) within 12 hours. 



All are advised to continue monitoring for updates.
